fr.lri.swingstates.animations

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.lri.swingstates.animations.Animation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimationFillPaint, AnimationOutlinePaint, AnimationRotateBy, AnimationRotateTo, AnimationScaleBy, AnimationScaleTo, AnimationTranslateBy, AnimationTranslateTo, AnimationTransparency

    public abstract class Animation
extends java.lang.Object

    An animation to control a continuous change on a CElement: a CShape, a CTag or a Canvas. Animating a CTag or a Canvas means animating every CShape tagged by this tag or displayed in this canvas.

    An animation lasts a given number of "laps". A "lap" lasts durationLap milliseconds (by default, 1000). During a "lap", the value of a parameter t starts at 0 and ends at 1 for odd laps (and starts at 1 and ends at 0 for even laps. Value of parameter t whose value is updated every delay milliseconds (by default, 40). t value follows a pacing funcyion (by default, a linear pacing function). An animation can be started, stopped, suspended and resumed.

    You can also override the methods doStart(), doStop(), doSuspend() and doResume() to define specific treatments applied when calling respectively the methods start(), stop(), suspend() and resume(). For example, if you want to change the color of the animated elements when you start and stop an animation that rotate and translate: 

     class AnimationRotateAndTranslateBy extends Animation {
        double rotate;
        double translatex, translatey;
 
        public AnimationRotateAndTranslateBy(double r, double tx, double ty) {
                super();
                rotate = r;
                translatex = tx;
                translatey = ty;
        }
 
        public void step(double t) {
                getAnimated().rotateBy(rotate).scaleBy(translatex, translatey);
        }
 
        public void doStart() {
                getAnimated().setFillPaint(Color.RED);
        }
 
        public void doStop() {
                getAnimated().setFillPaint(Color.LIGHT_GRAY);
        }
 }

    Author:
    Caroline Appert

      static short FUNCTION_LINEAR

      The constant to pass to the method setNbLaps(int) to make an animation never stop.

    • Field Detail

      • FUNCTION_LINEAR

        public static short FUNCTION_LINEAR
        The constant to pass to the method setFunction(short) to have a linear pacing function.

      • FUNCTION_SIGMOID

        public static short FUNCTION_SIGMOID
        The constant to pass to the method setFunction(short) to have a "sigmoid" pacing function. A sigmoid function corresponds to a slow-in/fast-out effect.

      • INFINITE_NUMBER_OF_LAPS

        public static int INFINITE_NUMBER_OF_LAPS
        The constant to pass to the method setNbLaps(int) to make an animation never stop.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Animation()
        Builds an animation and registers it to the animation manager.

    • Method Detail

      • resetAnimationManager

        public static void resetAnimationManager()
        For internal use. See class SwingStatesApplet.
        See Also:
        SwingStatesApplet.init()

      • setDelay

        public Animation setDelay(int d)
        Sets the delay between to successive values of the parameter t. By default, the value of the delay is 40 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        d - The delay in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        this animation.

      • getLapDuration

        public long getLapDuration()
        Returns:
        the duration (in milliseconds) of a lap of this animation.

      • setLapDuration

        public Animation setLapDuration(long d)
        Sets the duration of a "lap". By default, the value of the duration is 1000 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        d - The duration in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        this animation.

      • setFunction

        public Animation setFunction(short t)
        Sets the type of the pacing function, use the static constants Animation.FUNCTION_LINEAR or Animation.FUNCTION_SIGMOID. By default, the type function is linear.
        Parameters:
        t - The type of the pacing function.
        Returns:
        this animation.

      • setNbLaps

        public Animation setNbLaps(int laps)
        Sets the number of laps of this animation. By default, an animation lasts one lap (i.e. the parameter starts at 0 and ends at 1). For example, if one sets the number of laps to 2, the parameter starts at 0 and ends at 0 passing by 1.
        Parameters:
        laps - The number of laps.
        Returns:
        this animation.

      • setAnimatedElement

        public Animation setAnimatedElement(CElement ce)
        Sets the CElement that must be animated by this animation. If the canvas that must received animation events has not yet been set, it is set to the canvas to which belongs this CElement.
        Parameters:
        ce - The CElement to animate.
        Returns:
        this animation.

        public final Animation suspend()
